doc.field: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
creation: early 19th century; alteration: late 19th century; alteration: 1960s; alteration: 1991
Garrett White Home 1800--John White m Caroline Moore Home 1840

2 Story Brick, Molded Brick Cornice, 4 Bay, L-Plan, Flemish Bond, 3 Course American Bond, Queens Closers, Penciling, Scored Stucco Underpinning, Wood Shingles with Cut Nails with Stamped Heads, Mortise and Tenon Pegged Rafters with Roman Numerals, Reciprocating Saw Marks, Pitsaw Marks, Bulkhead Winter Kitchen, Originally 2 Front Doors then Transom with Sidelights, Rubbed Brick Jack Arches, 6 Flush Panel Doors, 6/6, 2/2, Blinds; 2 Tier Portico: Chamfered Columns, Rounded Rafters with Ridge Board; Summer Kitchen with Stone Chimney, Circular Granite Lined Well, Gambrel Roof Bank Barn, White Cemetery & Slave Cemetery; Log Corncrib: V-Notch, No Ridge Board
Frederick Nichols, Architect, West Wing--Marshall Wells, Architect
survey data: Virginia Road Traces--Architecture in Virginia
